decks.notes: The key concept of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by planeswalkers and card draw spells. The deck aims to control the board and win through incremental advantage, using powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to outvalue the opponent. The deck also has ways to recur important spells with Mystic Sanctuary and protect its game plan with Force of Negation. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure victory through superior card advantage and control.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various artifacts and spells, utilizing Urza, Lord High Artificer as a key piece to generate mana and card advantage. It also includes cards like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek for a combo win condition, alongside cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Pithing Needle for disruption. Whir of Invention serves as a versatile tutor, allowing the player to search for relevant pieces in different situations. The deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions for a slow and controlled victory.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, while utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. The main goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up storm count, eventually leading to a powerful finisher card like Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens. The deck also includes cards like Past in Flames and Gifts Ungiven to potentially recycle spells and find key combo pieces. The overall strategy is to efficiently chain together spells to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and burn spells to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game as fast as possible. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure to the opponent's life total, using efficient removal and direct damage spells to finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize. With a low curve and efficient threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong defense. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Lightning Bolt further punishes opponents for playing spells, making it difficult for them to mount a comeback.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while also utilizing versatile threats like Thing in the Ice and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Negation and Cryptic Command, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. The inclusion of snow covered lands allows for additional synergy with cards like Brazen Borrower and Mystic Sanctuary. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game and out-valuing the opponent through smart card selection and utilization.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Shriekhorn, then utilize cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate to deal direct damage to the opponent. This combo strategy allows the deck to consistently bring back creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats. Additionally, Life from the Loam helps to recycle lands and keep the engine running smoothly.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Emrakul, the Promised End. It also utilizes the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) for additional mana acceleration. The deck also includes cards for card advantage and control elements like Ancient Stirrings, Karn, the Great Creator, and Oblivion Stone. Additionally, it has utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Blast Zone to deal with opposing threats. The key strategy is to control the game, ramp up mana, and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to utilize cards that allow you to mill your own deck, filling up your graveyard with creatures to then bring back for free. Cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier help achieve this goal, while creatures like Gravecrawler and Narcomoeba can be brought back easily from the graveyard. By setting up your graveyard with key pieces like Vengevine and Prized Amalgam, you can overwhelm your opponent with a fast and relentless assault. The deck also includes cards like Creeping Chill to drain your opponent's life and Glimpse the Unthinkable to further mill your deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing the landfall triggers of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle in combination with ramp spells and Primeval Titan to quickly assemble the combo and deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck aims to ramp up its mana base with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with Mwonvuli Acid-Moss. With plenty of ways to find and play Valakut, the deck can consistently win through powerful Scapeshift plays or by overwhelming opponents with constant triggers from Primeval Titan's land searching ability.

Utilize powerful self-inflicted life loss to fuel the strength of Death's Shadow and other high-power creatures, quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive threats and disruption. The deck combines efficient creatures, hand disruption, removal spells, and card selection to maintain pressure and control the game's pace, with the ability to close out games quickly through large creature attacks and potential combo finishes with Temur Battle Rage. The deck focuses on making optimal use of the graveyard and toolbox cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald to adapt to various game situations and maximize its efficiency.

This deck focuses on efficiently deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing ramp cards like Expedition Map and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to get ahead on mana and cast threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of schedule. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Ugin, the Ineffable provides additional value. The deck's main goal is to apply pressure early and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This Modern Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The key strategy is to continually apply pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack. By using a combination of direct damage and creature attacks, the deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is also optimized for consistent and fast casting of spells to maintain a high tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building up +1/+1 counters on creatures using cards like Hardened Scales, Metallic Mimic, and Animation Module. This allows for explosive plays with cards like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista, while also enabling Hangarback Walker to generate an army of Thopter tokens. By efficiently utilizing resources like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of larger-than-life creatures and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using creatures with valuable abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Chord of Calling, players can search for specific creatures to combo off with, disrupt opponents, or gain value over time. The inclusion of Yawgmoth, Thran Physician as a key player in the deck allows for additional synergy and removal options. The deck aims to assemble efficient creature-based combos and overwhelm opponents with its versatile toolbox of creatures.

The deck aims to control the game by leveraging artifact synergies and powerful planeswalkers. It utilizes cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate mana and card advantage. The deck also incorporates disruptive elements like Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing artifacts. The strategy involves quickly ramping into big plays while undermining the opponent's game plan. The efficient interactions between artifacts, planeswalkers, and the control elements make the deck a formidable force in the Modern format.

The main focus of this Modern Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to utilize cheap and efficient creatures along with a variety of spells to deal direct damage quickly and overwhelm the opponent. By maximizing the use of instant and sorcery cards, the deck aims to maintain a fast tempo and pressure the opponent with aggressive plays. The inclusion of cantrips like Mishra's Bauble and card draw spells like Light Up the Stage helps to ensure the deck maintains momentum and consistently has options available.
